list.name: Changes
list.comment:
Old files have been imported, updates have started.
now to learn connecting with a SQL database.

task.summary: Default task

Got organized on my new windows machine after apache2 and nginx bricked my linux laptop trying to both run at startup with default config values >.<. I have managed to start the javascript validation code, definitely still in the beginning stages though. Steady as she goes.
Well I hate javascript right now.. It refuses to run my validation code even though everything aooears to be set up right... fuck.

Figured out my problem! Thanks professor!
Continuing on with client side validation setup, woo!
Set up error labels to the right of my text boxes on the registration form.

Done for the day. Tomorrow I my goal is to finish up with project 2 and start on project 3.
Project 2 still needs validation code for each of the input boxes in the form. Maybe a little cleaning up of the code as well. Hopefully no more than a couple of hours.
Run Adam run! Almost there!! We got this!!
organized code to add in the if functions for each of the form fields. All that is left to do is add the code! should take one more day. Woo!

Adding in validation code for on blur events.
Still need to add: password reqs repeat password reqs zipcode reqs phone number reqs
and submit validation for: state gender marital status and dob.
looking like I will be finishing tomorrow morning.

Finished adding: password reqs repeat password reqs zipcode reqs phone number reqs
stil working on: state gender marital status and dob.
All most done!! Run Adam Run!

Finished adding: state gender marital status and dob.
That is it! Time to turn in project 2 and start on project 3!

First Commit of project 3!
Time to organize and work as fast as possible! I have less than 3 days to get this finished to pass the class, we got this!
projectInfo updated, time to start scafolding the project!

Updated to a .php file and getting things started!
Taking some stabs at this php code, think I am starting to understand a few basics, but this will require a little focus.
A little confusing, but so far so good though.
moving along, excited to come back and work at it tomorrow!
I think I am finished! Hell yea! one more project to take care of tomorrow and I am done for the semester!

Actually, i decided to add some more code to make sure the valid form fields reappear on the form after submission.
I half broke the reset button in the process, but hey, I think this is better overall. Guess we will see.
Finished and ready to turn in
I was mistaken, I needed to update several layers of the validation; Thankfully I am almost done now.
Actually, this is MVP code, so I am done. Next project!

Project 4's First Commit!
Run Adam Run! you have 8.5 hours to get this done!

Old files have been imported, updates have started.
now to learn connecting with a SQL database.
